Thoughts in Early Winter - Meng Haoran

Trees shed leaves, and geese are flying south;
The north wind blows, here on the river it's cold.
My home is at the bend of the waters of Xiang,
Far beyond the edge of the clouds of Chu.
Travelling, I've exhausted my tears for home,
I watch a lone sail at the heavens' end.
The ferry's gone- who can I ask where?
Darkness falls beside the level sea.

Today is the big day.  A chance to change course from the lunatics who've had the wheel for the last 8 years.  Make it count.
Most of us have never had to fight in wars.  Most of us haven't been faced down by cops in riot gear.  Most of us haven't had dogs set loose on us.
Most of us haven't had our lives, or the lives of our children, threatened.
We have it pretty easy.
But this is our one obligation.  Get up and do it.  Stand in the lines, however long it takes.  Make your voices heard.
Things CAN be different.  Better.  
And Obama is right:  this isn't about him.  It's about YOU.  It's about all of us, together, getting out there and telling the system that we're not going to just sit back and be screwed anymore.  
This is the time.  
OUR time.

Make it count.

So... even though I am bogged down with book revisions and a crap-ton of homework, I've been making calls for the Obama campaign today.
I just hung up with this couple that were in their 70's.  This won't appear on any campaign commercial, but I thought y'all would be entertained by this story...

lady: "hello?"
me: "hi!  I'm calling for ________?"
lady: "that's me..."
me: "hi, my name's charlie, and I'm calling from barack obama's campaign for change.  do you know who you'll be voting for tomorrow?"
lady: "yes, i do.  I'll be voting for barack obama.  i'm sick of the rest of these bastards... oh, hold on..."
guy: "hello?! HELLO!? who in the hell is this?!"
me: "Um... i'm calling from... obama's... campaign for...change?"
guy: "enough double-talk, buddy.  are you a democrat or a republican?"
me: "a dem-"
guy: "YOU GODDAMN REPUBLICAN SONSABITCHES BETTER STOP CALLING ME.  I'M VOTING FOR OBAMA AND THERE AIN'T A DAMN THING YOU CAN DO ABOUT IT."
me: "Sir, I'm CALLING for the Obama campaign..."
guy: "... you are?"
me: "Yes, sir."
guy: "Oh.  Well, shit, i'm sorry.  Y'all give 'em hell tomorrow, now!"
